definition[0]: to have to stay in bed because you are ill or injured
example[0]: I was laid up for a week with flu.
definition[1]: to stop using a boat or vehicle, especially while it is being repaired
example[1]: Most of the yachts were laid up for the winter.
definition[2]: to collect and store something to use in the future
example[2]: We started laying up firewood for the winter.
definition[3]: a throw in basketball made from very close to the basket or from under it
